refnamediv.refpurpose: Set up an IP address range for dynamic DHCP

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq add dynamic range command sets up an IP address range to be used for dynamic DHCP.

Currently, this function just creates stub DNS entries for all the involved IP addresses. It's the task of the DHCP configuration generation process to interpret those stub records and convert them to real ranges.

The format of the generated FQDNs is PREFIX-IPSTR.DNS_DOMAIN, where IPSTR is the numeric IP address, with dots being replaced by dashes. See the documentation of the --dns_domain and --prefix options below for the default values of DNS_DOMAIN and PREFIX.

listitem.para: The --startip and --endip options specify the IP address range to set up, inclusive. The two IP addresses must be on the same network. If there are any DNS records or any network interfaces that use any of the IP addresses included, then the command will fail.

The --fillnetwork option causes all usable IP addresses in the network to be configured for dynamic DHCP. The range of usable IP addresses is determined by the type of the network. The first IP address to use is specified by the first_usable_offset key in the network_TYPE section of the broker's configuration. The last IP address to use is always the broadcast address minus one.
NETWORK can be either the network's IP address, or the network's name if the name is unique.

The name of the DNS domain where the stub records should be created. If not specified, the broker will look for a default DNS domain assigned to the location of the network, or its parent locations. If none of this locations have a default DNS domain assigned and the --dns_domain option is not specified either, the command will fail.
The prefix to use when generating FQDNs for the stub DNS entries. If not specified, it defaults to dynamic.
